summary: Real numbers are used to measure continuous quantities like distance or temperature. They can be represented as infinite decimals. Real numbers include rational numbers (like -5 and 4/3) and irrational numbers (like √2 and π). These numbers can be pictured on a number line. Real numbers are crucial in calculus and all math. They are denoted by a bold R. The concept was introduced by René Descartes to differentiate from imaginary numbers.
title: Real number
